about.leftColumnTitle: Frontend developer with over 2 years of experience
leftColumnDescription: I am a frontend developer with more than 2 years of commercial experience. I specialize in building modern, performant, and SEO-optimized interfaces with multi-language support.
I enjoy solving non-standard tasks where I can apply logic, mathematics, and critical thinking. I work with technologies such as React.js, Next.js, TypeScript, MongoDB, MySQL, Git, and others.
I strive to create scalable solutions that are easy to maintain and reuse in the future. I collaborate closely with teams, participate in architecture planning and optimize development workflows.

items.institution: National Technical University of Ukraine «Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute»

description: I work as a Frontend Developer in a product company, where I build multilingual, SEO-optimized websites using Next.js, TypeScript, React.js, and Vite.
I collaborate closely with the team, manage version control, and ensure stable development processes.
I participate in building projects using various microservices and develop branded websites for partner companies on demand.

skills.description: In my work, I use modern technologies, tools, and development approaches that help build efficient, fast, and scalable web applications. My stack includes both client-side and backend tools, as well as state management systems, databases, and UI utilities. This enables me to create solutions that combine clean code, well-designed architecture, and a smooth user experience.

items.title: Portfolio
items.shortDescription: A multilingual photographer's portfolio with galleries, admin panel, and a photoshoot booking form.
description: A photography portfolio with multilingual support, a contact form, and the ability to book a photoshoot. The website includes galleries with different categories, which the client can edit through the Sanity admin panel — adding photos, updating descriptions, and managing content.

The project supports multiple languages using next-intl and next-i18next, and integrates Google Business Profile reviews. Communication with the photographer is handled via a contact form that sends emails through the Microsoft Graph API.

items.title: JSON Architect
items.shortDescription: A tool for building data structures and generating JSON archives tailored to a specific project architecture.
description: A pet project where you can configure the structure for different system components step by step: each block is filled separately, and at the end a ready JSON file is generated, which can be used in the client's project architecture.
After filling in the fields, the app collects all data and generates an archive with all required files, simplifying integration into a real project and speeding up initial development.

Focus is placed on convenient form handling and strong validation: React Hook Form handles form logic, while Zod is responsible for schema and data validation. Application state is managed with Zustand, and archive generation is done with JSZip and File Saver.
The interface is built with Next.js and TailwindCSS, featuring animated transitions via Framer Motion. Components use Headless UI and Lucide React icons.

items.title: Movie Web App
items.shortDescription: A movie website with search, filtering and detail pages based on the TMDb API.
description: A modern web application for browsing popular movies, searching by keywords and filtering by genres. The interface includes ratings, descriptions, posters and other details.
Implemented dark/light theme, pagination, responsiveness and live content updates through the TMDb API. The app is optimized with Redux Toolkit and strict TypeScript typing.

items.title: Super Heroes Full-Stack App
items.shortDescription: A CRUD system for managing superheroes with a custom backend and database.
description: A full frontend + backend application where you can add, edit, delete and view superhero cards. Includes a user-friendly interface with input forms, image upload and pagination.
The backend is built with Node.js and Express, and MongoDB is used for data storage. The frontend uses Redux Toolkit for state management and TypeScript for safe typing.
The project was created as a learning CRUD system, covering the full cycle — from UI to database.

items.title: React Shop — Test Task
items.shortDescription: A product catalog with categories, cart and pagination, created as a test assignment.
description: This project was completed as a technical task for a company. The goal was to build an online shop with product categories, a basic shopping cart, pagination and a responsive interface.
The app is built with Next.js using server-side rendering and image optimization. Categories, products and a dedicated product page support full filtering and pagination functionality.
State management is handled with Redux Toolkit, which organizes cart logic, quantity synchronization, local storage support and overall data management.
The interface is built using HTML, CSS and Tailwind styling, structured into reusable UI components.
Additionally, clean code practices, static analysis via ESLint and TypeScript typing were implemented to prevent errors.

items.title: Words API Form
items.shortDescription: A form for working with the WordsAPI: searching meanings, antonyms, synonyms and other language data.
description: A single-page application built with Next.js that allows searching for words and retrieving information from the WordsAPI in multiple modes: synonyms, antonyms, definitions, examples and more.
The project includes a dynamic form using Next.js API routes, and TypeScript provides safe typing.
Input validation, error handling, a responsive interface and structured results display are implemented.
ESLint is used to ensure code quality and maintain consistent standards during development.
